text: at some point this summer you're
probably going to want a grilled chicken
breasts and this is a definitive way to
do it there are three basic things that
you need to keep in mind when cooking
chicken breasts on the grill you want to
pound them so they're an even thickness
but not too thin you want to marinate
them to add flavor and then you want to
grill them hot and fast
chicken breasts are very mild so you
want to give them an assertive marinade
I used salt and pepper of course thyme
garlic lemon and olive oil you should
let your chicken breasts sit in the
marinade for at least a couple of hours
but you don't want to do it too long so
I'd say two hours is your sweet spot
because I pounded the chicken breasts
pretty thin I cook them fast and hot and
that way they say juicy on the inside
and they get a nice sear on the outside
here's the thing about grilling with
charcoal is that you really have to use
your judgment so if you have a nice fire
going and you have very hot coals and
you want to slow it down you cover it
because that deprives the flames of
oxygen and it slows it down but if you
want a hotter flame then you take the
cover off and that adds oxygen and
that'll give you more heat it's not an
exact science
whenever I guard is something I'd like
to play up the flavors that are already
in the marinade so for this I added some
more fresh lemon juice I added more
herbs and a little more olive oil just
to bring out those flavors at the very
end
Oh
